segments.text: Wow , that terrible movie is finally over . Next time I ’ m picking the film , because I don ’ t want to end up seeing a chick flick .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well you should have picked , in the end you always complain about everything .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not everything , just this film . Even the title is ridiculous . and it ’ s so long , those are the two and a half most wasted hours of my life , so much so that I ’ m thinking about asking them to give me my money back .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m thinking of taking you back home . I thought we could have a nice evening , but you ’ re always so negative .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m only complaining about a movie that I could have rented or bought and then thrown in the garbage .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You see , that ’ s what I ’ m talking about , I can ’ t stand your sarcastic jokes anymore
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Next time , go with your gay friend who is more in touch with his feelings .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well he ’ s more of a man than you are ; at least he appreciates love stories .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don ’ t criticize Mario or else I ’ ll start on those fat , drunk friends of yours ; they ’ re no saints .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: My friends ? Fat ? What about those whales you call friends ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You ’ re unbearable ; you can walk home , I ’ m leaving .
segments.speaker: S2
